items.title: Colts star should be a top option for Commanders in free agency
items.summary: Colts WR Alec Pierce had a big game on Monday Night Football. He's a free agent in March. The Commanders should be interested.

items.title: QB Brock Purdy and RB Christian McCaffrey help lead 49ers past Colts
items.summary: Here's what to know from the 49ers' win over the Colts on Monday night.

items.title: Philip Rivers' impressive showing against 49ers proves he can still hang in NFL
items.summary: Rivers completed 23-of-45 passes for 277 yards and two touchdowns on Monday night.

items.title: Purdy authors 'close to a perfect game' with 5 TDs
items.summary: With 44-year-old Colts quarterback Philip Rivers and his comeback occupying most of the headlines entering Monday's game, it was Brock Purdy who stole the show, throwing five touchdown passes in leading San Francisco to a 48-27 win at Lucas Oil Stadium.

items.title: Metcalf suspended two games for fan altercation
items.summary: The NFL has suspended Steelers wide receiver DK Metcalf for two games without pay due to his altercation with a fan at Detroit's Ford Field on Sunday.

items.title: Rivers turns back clock but can't will Colts to win
items.summary: Newly unretired Philip Rivers turned in an impressive individual performance Monday night that saw him throw for 277 yards and two touchdowns. But it wasn't enough to deliver the Colts a win against the 49ers as Indianapolis saw its playoff hopes fade.

items.title: NFL suspends Chargers LB Perryman two games
items.summary: The NFL suspended Chargers LB Denzel Perryman two games cited repeated violations of player safety rules, including during Sunday's win over the Cowboys.

items.title: Colts' defense accepts accountability in Monday night loss to 49ers: 'We got dominated today'
items.summary: The Colts' defense allowed five touchdowns and did not force a punt in their 48-27 loss to the San Francisco 49ers on Monday night.

items.title: Colts lose fifth straight to 49ers on MNF as playoff hopes hang by a thread
items.summary: The tightrope finally snapped inside Lucas Oil Stadium on primetime Monday Night Football as the Indianapolis Colts suffered a fifth straight loss in a 48-27 blowout against the San Francisco 49ers. What began as a hopeful holiday stage to showcase what was at one point the league’s most explosive offensive unit entering the Week 11 […]

items.title: Colts QB Philip Rivers finds fountain of youth in primetime, but Indy defense lays major dud vs. 49ers
items.summary: The desperate Indianapolis Colts (8-7) were fighting for their increasingly slim playoff odds, but if you want to blame someone after falling to the San Francisco 49ers (11-4), 48-27, on Monday Night Football, don’t blame grizzled veteran Philip Rivers (i.e., ‘Grandpa Phil’). The 44-year-old longtime veteran quarterback, who shockingly unretired two weeks ago and had […]

items.title: Colts playoff picture: What Week 16 vs. 49ers means for AFC standings
items.summary: Game result: The Colts came up short against the 49ers and dropped to 8-7 with the loss. They are officially eliminated from AFC South contention, but remain alive in the wild card race. They are two games back of the Texans. The Colts host the Jaguars and travel to face the Texans the final two […]

items.title: 49ers offense can't be stopped in 48-27 win over Colts
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS - A primetime game on their home turf wasn't enough for the Indianapolis Colts to snap their losing streak as the San Francisco 49ers won their Monday night matchup, 41-27 at Lucas Oil Stadium. The Colts have now lost five straight and six of their last seven games after a 7-1 start. Their playoff [...]

items.title: Colts defense struggles vs. 49ers in fifth consecutive loss
items.summary: The Colts allowed 441 yards of total offense in the 48-27 loss.

items.title: Philip Rivers took the 49ers to school on Colts opening drive
items.summary: Indianapolis, IN — Clinical, surgical, teach tape: these are just a few words that accurately describe Philip Rivers’s opening drive in primetime against the San Francisco 49ers. Starting center Tanor Bortolini went down early with a concussion, making it the Colts’ third consecutive week in which a starting offensive lineman left the game with injury, […]

items.title: Week 16 Colts vs. 49ers Game discussion
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts are at home to take on the San Francisco 49ers in week 16 of the 2025 season, kickoff is at 7:00 p.m. EST on Monday Night Football. The Colts are at home in primetime on Monday Night Football. Philip Rivers is starting at quarterback and somewhere up there Jim Irsay is smiling down on […]

items.title: Colts announce 7 inactive players for Week 16 game vs. San Francisco 49ers
items.summary: The Colts on Saturday ruled out cornerback Sauce Gardner and wide receiver Anthony Gould; tackle Bernhard Raimann was downgraded to out on Sunday.

items.title: Can Jonathan Taylor get back to form against the 49ers?
items.summary: It wasn’t so long ago that Jonathan Taylor was the front runner for Offensive Player of the Year and a sleeper pick for MVP despite being a Running Back. But the past month has done him no favors in his candidacy for either award. In his 4 games since the Bye Week, Taylor’s stats have […]

items.title: Where to Watch: 49ers at Colts for MNF
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts (8-6) host the San Francisco 49ers (10-4) on primetime (8:15 PM EST) trying to keep their late season playoff hopes alive. Having lost 5 of their last 6 games, it’s desperation time in Indy. Entering the evening, the Colts average the league’s 6th most points (28.0 avg. ppg.) and surrender its 13th […]

items.title: How Week 16 reset the race for the AFC and NFC 1-seeds: Barnwell on the NFL's best teams
items.summary: Will the Broncos hold off the Patriots in the AFC and get the first-round bye in the playoffs? Can the Seahawks stay ahead of the Rams in the NFC?

items.title: Colts activate DeForest Buckner from injured reserve
items.summary: Indianapolis, IN — The Indianapolis Colts have received a big-time reinforcement ahead of their Monday Night Football matchup against the San Francisco 49ers. Star defensive tackle DeForest Buckner (neck) has officially been activated from the injured reserve list after missing the last five games, a fitting return to the limelight as this is Indy’s first […]

items.title: Colts activate DT DeForest Buckner from injured reserve, waive QB Brett Rypien; elevate WR Coleman Owen, G Josh Sills from practice squad to active roster for Week 16
items.summary: Buckner will be active for the first time since sustaining a neck injury during the Colts' Week 9 loss to the Pittsburgh Steelers.

items.title: Two vulnerable NFL sack records: Tracking pace for Myles Garrett (22!), Broncos' D (63!)
items.summary: The Browns' vet edge rusher and Denver's defense are in contention to rewrite the single-season sacks record book.

items.summary: TV broadcast, radio and streaming information for San Francisco 49ers at Indianapolis Colts on Monday, December 22 at 8:15 p.m. ET (Week 16).

items.title: The Colts lost control of their destiny, and the rest of the league isn’t doing them any favors
items.summary: At 7-1, the Indianapolis Colts were in firm control, not only of the AFC South but of the entire AFC. A tie breaker win over the Denver Broncos provided that much more room to breathe. Things were smooth sailing until they weren’t. With four straight losses and five out of six dropped, the Colts no […]

items.title: Colts will be without their blindside bookend for MNF
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts announced on Sunday that starting left tackle Bernhard Raimann (elbow) has been downgraded from questionable to out for Monday Night football’s home game against the San Francisco 49ers. Raimann was able to practice on a limited basis on Saturday for the first time all week, with an arm brace on his injured […]

items.title: Niners at Colts: What to watch for
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Areas of interest in the Indianapolis Colts’ Monday night meeting with the San Francisco 49ers at Lucas Oil Stadium. History lesson, Part I The Colts lead the overall series 27-18, although the bulk of the series predates their relocation to Indy. Since the move in 1984, they’ve met just 10 times, with the [...]

items.title: Roof closed as Colts host 49ers for MNF
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — The roof is closed this week as the Colts prepare to defend home turf against quarterback Brock Purdy and the San Francisco 49ers. The Monday Night Football matchup will see Philip Rivers return to Lucas Oil Stadium as he attempts to lead the 8-6 Colts back into the win column against the 10-4 [...]

items.title: Colts-49ers preview: What can Philip Rivers, Jonathan Taylor do on Monday Night Football?
items.summary: The Colts' game plan in Week 15 was to lean heavily on their run game. Could this week's matchup against the San Francisco 49ers be a prime opportunity to do that again?

items.summary: The Colts Show Mailbag returns for Week 16 as JJ Stankevitz answers listener, viewer and reader questions on Colts.com.

items.title: GAMEDAY ALERT: Road closures and delays expected for Colts fans
items.summary: Capitol Ave southbound closure through 2026 will affect all remaining Indianapolis Colts games at Lucas Oil Stadium.

items.title: Colts’ DeForest Buckner had to weigh ‘long-term life’ issues when deciding to return
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The decision wasn’t as clear-cut as it appears. Of course, DeForest Buckner wanted to get back on the field. He’s the defensive heartbeat of the Indianapolis Colts and his teammates were caught in the grips of a late-season fade that’s threatening their playoff hopes. “Obviously, the competitor I am and what I can [...]

items.title: Colts rule out CB Sauce Gardner, WR Anthony Gould for Week 16 game vs. San Francisco 49ers
items.summary: DeForest Buckner was a full participant in practice on Thursday and Friday.

items.title: Did you know there are 13 active former No. 1 picks in the NFL? We examine them all
items.summary: Matthew Stafford, Myles Garrett are having the best seasons of all 13 of the former No. 1 picks currently in the NFL.

items.title: Philip Rivers feels ‘a week better,’ but that must translate into Colts wins
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – After a frenetic week of transitioning from high school coach to the NFL’s oldest player, Philip Rivers has settled back into the daily grind that used to dictate his life for 17 seasons. Team meetings, positional meetings, work in the weight room, more meetings, walkthroughs and practices. And taking inventory of his 44-year-old [...]

items.title: Practice Notebook: DeForest Buckner taking things one day at a time as he returns from neck injury
items.summary: Buckner was a full participant in Friday's practice, marking his second consecutive day of full participation.

items.title: Anthony Richardson Sr. returns to practice as a limited participant
items.summary: The Colts opened Richardson's 21-day window to be activated from injured reserve on Wednesday but the quarterback still has some vision limitations, Shane Steichen said.

items.title: Practice Notebook: Injury updates on DeForest Buckner, Sauce Gardner, other Colts players ahead of Week 16 game vs. San Francisco 49ers
items.summary: Buckner (neck) was a full participant on Wednesday. Gardner (calf) did not practice.

items.title: Colts Blue Zone Podcast 450: Philip Rivers, Take Two
items.summary: If you wanted to see Philip Rivers in the Colts' all-blue "Indiana Nights" uniform, your prayers have been answered. Rivers' second act will get its own second act against the San Francisco 49ers on Monday Night Football as the Colts try to keep their playoff hopes alive. Dave Griffiths, Mike Chappell and Matt Adams preview [...]

items.title: Philip Rivers feeling good after 'helpful' hits vs. Seahawks, eyes improvements in Colts' Monday Night Football game against 49ers
items.summary: Philip Rivers was hit three times by Seahawks defenders on Sunday, which was his first time in a helmet and shoulder pads in nearly five years.

items.title: Colts’ Anthony Richardson Sr. cleared for practice:  ‘I thank God'
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Despite being minutes removed from a freaky, horrific accident, Anthony Richardson Sr. received comforting news. There was a brief instant as he was being whisked to a local hospital on Oct. 12, when Richardson wondered if the fractured right orbital bone might threaten his career. Reassurance quickly came from a tending EMT. “Nah, [...]

items.title: Colts designate QB Anthony Richardson Sr., S Daniel Scott to return to practice
items.summary: Richardson was placed on injured reserve with a fractured orbital bone in Week 7.

items.title: Colts’ D did a lot of good against Seattle, just not quite enough
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – There were so many winnable defensive stats. A few more were needed. In Sunday’s 18-16 loss at Seattle, the Indianapolis Colts’ defense kept Sam Darnold and the Seahawk’s potent offense – No. 2 in scoring (29.8) – out of the end zone for the first time this season, limited their run game to [...]

items.title: Colts offense sees more for Philip Rivers after Week 15 performance
items.summary: Head coach Shane Steichen on Monday confirmed Rivers would be the Colts' starting quarterback against the San Francisco 49ers.

items.title: How Colts could kick off vs. 49ers controlling AFC playoff destiny
items.summary: Despite losing their last four games, the 8-6 Colts still have a chance to make the playoffs. Here's what the team is staring down over the final three weeks of the 2025 regular season:

items.title: 'Indiana Nights' to take center stage for 'Monday Night Football' in Indy
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts will celebrate “Indiana Nights” and wear their “Indiana Nights” alternate uniform when they host a Monday Night Football matchup with the San Francisco 49ers at Lucas Oil Stadium on Dec. 22.

items.title: How Shaquille Leonard rediscovered his love for football after the NFL
items.summary: Former Colts three-time All-Pro linebacker Shaquille Leonard joined this week's episode of The Colts Show for a wide-ranging conversation about everything from high school football to the 2025 Colts.

items.title: Bill Brooks' Breakdown: How Philip Rivers and Colts receivers can continue to build chemistry
items.summary: Colts Ring of Honor wide receiver Bill Brooks provides his insight into how Philip Rivers and the his wide receivers were able to quickly build chemistry last week, and how important their communication and mutual trust will be for the Colts going forward.

items.title: Clear: Philip Rivers is Colts’ starting QB; Unclear: Anthony Richardson Sr.’s status
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The Philip Rivers comeback tour never was going to be a one-event experience. In the aftermath of Rivers making his first start in nearly five years in Sunday’s 18-16 loss at Seattle, Shane Steichen made it clear the Indianapolis Colts are sticking with their 44-year-old quarterback. “Yeah, Philip will be our starting quarterback,’’ [...]

items.title: Philip Rivers will be Colts' Week 16 starter, Anthony Richardson Sr. cleared 'from an eye standpoint'
items.summary: Steichen said on Monday that Richardson has been cleared to begin physical activity, but when he will return to practice is undetermined.

items.title: Colts name Indy's Chanel Parker 2025 'Inspire Change' Changemaker
items.summary: The award recognizes individuals who are making a difference in their communities through social justice work – primarily in education, economic advancement, police-community relations or criminal justice reform – across each of the NFL’s 32 club markets.

items.title: Colts’ Anthony Richardson Sr. cleared for football activities, but time for return is short
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Anthony Richardson Sr. has been cleared to resume football-related activities, according to a source with knowledge of the situation, but there’s no indication he’ll return for one of the Indianapolis Colts’ final three games. Richardson remains on the injured reserve list after fracturing an orbital bone during a freak accident prior to the [...]

items.title: 5 Colts Things: Philip Rivers' late completion to Alec Pierce, how injuries impacted loss to Seahawks, context for defense not allowing a touchdowns in defeat
items.summary: The Colts lost, 18-16, to the Seattle Seahawks on Sunday at Lumen Field. It was their fourth consecutive loss, but the Colts saw some things they believe they can build upon over the final three weeks of the 2025 regular season.

items.title: Around the AFC South: Texans and Jaguars both score 40+, Titans fall to 49ers
items.summary: The Jaguars improved to 10-4 and the Texans moved to 9-5 on Sunday; the Colts moved to 8-6 with their loss to the Seahawks.

items.title: Colts Blue Zone Podcast 449: Somehow, It Almost Worked
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts lost a heartbreaker to one of the league's best teams after bringing Philip Rivers out of retirement to run the offense. Matt Adams recaps the game and laments a few missed opportunities. Find the Colts Blue Zone Podcast on YouTube, Apple Podcasts or Spotify.

items.title: Storybook ending failed to materialize as Colts, Philip Rivers came up short versus Seattle
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — Sometimes, and it’s rare, you can do almost everything right and still wind up with the wrong ending to a story. Like the Grandpa Phil Comeback narrative. Like the Indianapolis Colts dropping an 18-16 decision to the Seahawks Sunday in Seattle. They followed the only real script that made much sense with the [...]

items.title: Where do Philip Rivers, Colts go for rest of 2025 season after loss to Seahawks?
items.summary: The novelty of Philip Rivers' return to the NFL wore off when the clock hit zero at Lumen Field on Sunday. Now, the question becomes: Can the Colts actually pull this off over the final three weeks of the 2025 season?

items.title: Philip Rivers grateful for chance to play again, but disappointed after Colts' loss to Seahawks: 'This isn't about me'
items.summary: Philip Rivers threw career touchdown No. 422 and took every snap behind center for the Colts on Sunday, but he came away from his first game in nearly five years mainly disappointed in the outcome for his team.
